text.name: froggy
text.description: Well done, you have completed the game!

text.name: rateau
text.description: A rake is a gardening tool used for raking dead leaves or grass.

text.name: arrosoir
text.description: A watering can is a container with a handle and a spout, used for watering plants.

text.name: elec
text.description: Electricity is a form of energy resulting from the movement of electrons.

text.name: rotten
text.description: A rotten fruit is a fruit that has started to decompose and is no longer edible.

text.name: trash
text.description: Trash refers to objects or substances that are discarded because they are no longer useful or necessary.

text.name: velo
text.description: A bicycle is an eco-friendly and healthy means of transportation, propelled by muscular force.

text.name: solaire
text.description: Solar energy is produced from sunlight, captured by solar panels to generate electricity.

text.name: eolienne
text.description: Wind energy is produced by the force of the wind and captured by wind turbines to generate electricity.

text.name: hydraulique
text.description: Hydraulic energy is produced by the force of moving water, used in hydroelectric dams to generate electricity.

text.name: biomasse
text.description: Biomass is energy produced from organic matter, such as wood, agricultural waste, and urban waste, transformed into fuel or biogas.

text.name: geothermique
text.description: Geothermal energy is produced by the heat of the Earth, harnessed through geothermal power plants to produce heat or electricity.

text.name: secateur
text.description: Pruners are gardening tools used for pruning smaller branches, cutting plant stems, and removing dead flowers. They enable clean and precise cuts, thus promoting plant health.

text.name: seau
text.description: A bucket is a useful container for carrying water, collecting garden waste, storing tools, and gathering harvests.

text.name: fourche
text.description: A pitchfork is a tool with prongs used for aerating soil, breaking up clumps, and uprooting weeds in the garden.

text.name: balai
text.description: A leaf broom is a tool used to gather and clean up dead leaves, debris, and other garden litter, thus facilitating the maintenance of a clean and orderly outdoor space.

text.name: compost
text.description: Compost is a mixture of decomposing organic matter, such as food scraps, dead leaves, and manure, used as a natural fertilizer to enrich garden soil.

text.name: eppluchures
text.description: Fruit and vegetable peelings are food waste that can be added to compost to enrich the soil with nutrients.

text.name: feuilles_mortes
text.description: Dead leaves are a valuable source of organic matter for composting, providing essential nutrients and promoting soil health in the garden.

text.name: papier
text.description: Paper, especially uncolored paper, is an excellent source of carbonaceous matter for compost. It can be shredded and added to the compost pile to promote decomposition and improve soil structure.

text.name: branches
text.description: Branches and small pruning cuts are woody materials that can be composted to provide structure and nutrients to the compost pile. They decompose slowly and help aerate the pile.

text.name: laitue
text.description: Lettuce is a leafy green plant often used as a base for salads. It is rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, making it an excellent addition to a balanced diet.

text.name: basilic
text.description: Basil is a plant with pretty green leaves that smell very good! It is often used to make tomato sauce or to flavor our favorite dishes like pasta or pizza.

text.name: tomate
text.description: The tomato is a red and juicy fruit found in gardens. It can be eaten raw in salads or cooked in sauces and soups.

text.name: fraisier
text.description: The strawberry is a plant that produces delicious red and sweet strawberries. They can be eaten as they are, or they can be used in desserts like pies or fruit salads.

text.name: haricots
text.description: Beans are tall plants with pretty flowers and green pods. Inside the pods, there are small seeds that can be eaten after cooking.

text.name: potiron
text.description: The pumpkin is a large, round, orange vegetable that grows in gardens in the autumn. It can be used to make delicious soups or pies to warm up when it's cold outside!
